summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in payroll and certification reports from April, August, and December of 1978. These documents provide his name, and in some cases, his annual salary and gross pay for the specified periods. The documents serve as administrative records of his employment with the HSCA.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in these documents.
